title: FCC Chairman Pai to Step Down, Giving Biden Clearer Path to Reshape Agenda
sub_head: January departure allows new administration to choose next head of telecommunications regulator
body:
WASHINGTON—President-elect Joe Biden gained a clearer path to redirecting U.S. telecommunications policy Monday, after Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai announced plans to step down on Jan. 20, 2021.
The Republican chairman’s departure will allow Democrats to start work soon after Inauguration Day on their expected priorities, including restoring Obama-era net-neutrality rules regulating how internet service providers treat traffic on their networks.
